column5: AA *buŋ[ ] 'belly', *dul 'middle, belly' MKED, widespread confusion of 'belly' ~ 'intestine'
cf. Mal/T'in ɲam; Palaung jəm 'black'; Lao dàm 'black'
cf. Khmu tmʰmɔːŋ; Muak Saak psim3
AA *rɔs MKED; PT *χaɰᴮ (Pittayaporn 2009) (Tai tone category, inconsistent with Vietic)
AA *rus, raːs to fall, shed' MKED
cf. Semelai ɟon, Pacoh ʄoːn etc. 'to have'
cf. Chinese 頭 tóu, OC *[m-t]ˤo (Baxter & Sagart 2014)
cf. Chinese 心 xīn, OC *səm (Baxter & Sagart 2014)
cf. Nancowry Nicobarese ɲiː; Mang ɲua⁶ 'house'
AA *kluːŋ/*[k]luəŋ 'middle/belly'; cf. Chinese 中 zhōng, Sino-Vietnamese trung
PT *rɯ:wᶜ (Pittayaporn 2009) note r>h in Lao etc.
AA *t1luəm MKED; Chinese 肝 gān, OC *s.kˤa[r] (Baxter & Sagart 2014) early Vietic loan
Chinese 舊 jiu4, Old Chinese *N-kʷəʔ-s (Baxter & Sagart 2014), borrowed into Tai *kawB (Pittayaporn 2009)
AA *muːj MKED, coda irregular in Vietic
Chinese 視 shì, OC *gijʔ(-s) (Baxter & Sagart 2014) 'look, see'
cf. Lao tá cá 'skin, bark' (< Pali);  Vietnamese lột 'to slough'
AA *niʔ MKED; similar forms regionally widespread.
AA *ɓaːr MKED; not obviously related to Vietic *haːr
AA *jaːm MKED; PHM *ʔɲæmX (Ratliff 2010); Chinese 哭 ku1 "weep", Old Chinese *[kʰ]ˤok (Baxter & Sagart 2014)
cf. Chinese 何 he2, Old Chinese *[g]ˤaj, *[g]ˤe (Baxter & Sagart 2014)
AA *klaŋʔ; *kl(uə)k MKED; Chinese 白 bái "white" Old Chinese *bˤrak (Baxter & Sagart 2014). Why Thavung lok, without the /p/?
Cf. Lao kʰwǎːŋ; Chinese 廣 guǎng
